9DMSVCRV.title: Temporal and spatial soil moisture–precipitation coupling relationships over the tibetan plateau
9DMSVCRV.archive_path: [ARCHIVE] Processes/Soil Moisture/Soil Moisture Dynamics, Hazards/Drought, Methodology/Remote Sensing/Retrieval, Methodology/Statistical Methods, Applications/Early Warning Systems
9DMSVCRV.idea_path: [IDEA] Mechanism/Land-Atmosphere Coupling, Dynamics/Non-linearity & Complexity, Data Philosophy/Multi-Source Integration

keyword_assessment.current: Soil moisture significantly influences weather and climate via land‒atmosphere interactions over the Tibetan Plateau. However, the temporal and spatial preferences of precipitation for soil moisture anomalies and the underlying mechanisms over the plateau remain undetermined. Using multiple satellite datasets and ERA5 reanalysis data, this study quantifies the temporal and spatial soil moisture–precipitation coupling (SMPC) relationships during seven summers (2015–2021) based on a percentile‐based method. The findings highlight prevalent positive temporal SMPC, indicating wetter-than-normal soil conditions lead to more afternoon precipitation. ERA5 generally aligns with satellite findings but underestimates areas with positive temporal SMPC. Spatial SMPC relationships are usually statistically insignificant, with some regions showing significant positive relationships, where precipitation is more likely over wetter soils. This study provides new insights into SMPC and its implications for precipitation forecasting over the plateau.
keyword_assessment.suggested: Tibetan Plateau, soil moisture-precipitation coupling (SMPC), land-atmosphere interactions, temporal coupling, spatial coupling, satellite data, reanalysis data, precipitation forecasting
keyword_assessment.reason: The provided text is the abstract, not keywords. The suggested keywords cover the geographical area, the core phenomenon (SMPC), the underlying process (land-atmosphere interactions), the temporal and spatial aspects, the data sources, and the application (precipitation forecasting).
